The Association for Computing Machinery

at UTSA

About ACM

The Association for Computing Machinery at UTSA is dedicated to giving members and students the opportunity to gain experience, network, socialize, learn, and grow outside of the classroom in all fields of technology and computing.

Organization

Our chapter is organized to serve students for academic, professional, and social purposes at UTSA. The Chapter shall be involved with and conduct activities that are included below.

Engaging

students in stimulating computing activities

Mentoring

students for academic and professional success

Advancing

the art, science, engineering, and application of information technology

Connecting

students with leaders in the computing field

Encouraging

the pursuit of career opportunities in computing

Promoting

the highest professional and ethical standards

Our Sub Organizations

  • ACM-W

    Minority centric chapter focusing on creating an academic and professional community

  • ICPC

    Competitive programming for students looking to expand their coding skills

  • RowdyHacks

    ACM's 24-hour hackathon competition with hundreds of students, sponsors, and prizes

  • Rowdy Creators

    ACMâ€™s multi-discipline incubator specializing in helping students learn and contribute to long-term technology projects
